outcomes.note: string

media.alt: string

use_cases.title: Autonomous site inspections with Boston Dynamics Spot
use_cases.summary: Turner uses Boston Dynamics’ Spot robots integrated with DroneDeploy to autonomously capture 360° imagery overnight, reducing manual inspection time.

media.alt: Turner Construction: Advancing Robotics in Construction with Spot
Turner Construction: Advancing Robotics in Construction with Spot

use_cases.title: Crane operations optimization with AI/IoT
use_cases.summary: Turner equips cranes with Versatile’s CraneView sensor to capture data on loads, motions, and productivity, turning cranes into smart devices for operational insights.

media.alt: Versatile's CraneView: Construction Digitization in Action
Versatile's CraneView: Construction Digitization in Action

use_cases.title: Generative AI for site layout optimization
use_cases.summary: Autodesk Forma leverages generative AI to evaluate site layouts for noise, wind, embodied carbon, and other factors, providing designers early feedback.

media.alt: What is Autodesk Forma
What is Autodesk Forma

use_cases.title: AI-driven bridge condition assessment
use_cases.summary: Bentley combines digital twins, sensor data, and AI to assess bridge condition and prioritize maintenance.

media.alt: Bentley: Bridge Monitoring Solution
Bentley: Bridge Monitoring Solution

use_cases.title: AI Chatbot for Jobsite Safety Planning
use_cases.summary: Skanska USA developed the Safety Sidekick, an internal generative AI chatbot designed to help project teams quickly access and summarize safety information, prepare toolbox talks, and reinforce site-specific safety guidance.
use_cases.notes: Documented by Skanska and featured in Construction Today; validated internal deployment across U.S. business units.

use_cases.title: AI/ML-Driven Hazard Capture and Safety Reporting
use_cases.summary: PCL Construction created an internal HSE Inspection App that leverages AI and machine learning to capture, classify, and analyze safety observations from field inspections, enabling data-driven safety performance improvement across projects.
use_cases.notes: Official owner-published description of a deployed AI-enabled safety tool; validated by internal operational data.

use_cases.title: AI-Assisted Building Permitting in Abu Dhabi
use_cases.summary: Abu Dhabi’s municipal authority deployed an AI-driven plan review platform integrated with BIM and a generative AI chatbot to streamline building permit approvals. The system automates code compliance checks on submitted building models and provides users instant guidance on regulations, improving review efficiency and accuracy.

companies.name: Abu Dhabi Department of Municipalities and Transport

use_cases.notes: Announced by Abu Dhabi’s government; expected to reduce permit review times and enhance compliance via automated checks and AI chat assistance.

use_cases.title: Computer Vision Safety Monitoring on Grand Paris Express
use_cases.summary: On France’s Grand Paris Express transit project, an AI-driven vision system monitors construction tunnels for safety violations. Cameras and AI software detect issues like missing PPE or unsafe worker-machine proximity, then alert and log incidents automatically. The system filters out false positives as it learns and even pixelates workers’ faces to protect privacy.
use_cases.notes: Tested by the contractor on one of Europe’s largest infrastructure projects; shows how AI can augment safety enforcement in real time.

use_cases.title: AI Optimizes Building HVAC Energy Use in Berlin
use_cases.summary: At the Treptower office complex in Berlin, an AI-driven HVAC control system (DABBEL AI) autonomously managed heating and cooling. By learning from real-time sensor, occupancy, and weather data, it cut HVAC energy consumption by 36%, saving ~1.76 GWh and 605 tons CO2 annually, which equated to over €180,000 saved in 2023.
use_cases.notes: Case study co-developed with the Solar Impulse Foundation; demonstrates real-world energy and cost impact of AI in facilities management.

use_cases.title: STRABAG AI Building Design Optimization
use_cases.summary: STRABAG used algorithms and generative design to evaluate its energy efficiency right from the initial design and planning phase. Based on data from Google Earth and using the escape and rescue route plans, the planners determine the design parameters such as air volumes and heat and cooling loads in the preliminary design.

media.alt: STRABAG AI-driven scheduling dashboard for construction management

use_cases.notes: Described in independent AI Expert Network documentation and STRABAG digital innovation releases; confirmed active rollout on European sites.

use_cases.title: Rogers-O'Brien Construction Sets New Standard with Custom AI Assistant
use_cases.summary: Rogers-O’Brien Construction launched “Compass,” an in-house generative-AI assistant that connects to Procore, Bridgit Bench, internal playbooks, an employee directory, and a data lake to surface project and staffing information for teams.

outcomes.note: Reported in launch announcement; internal productivity benchmark.

media.alt: Rogers-O’Brien Compass AI assistant interface

use_cases.notes: Owner announcement notes integrations with Procore, Bridgit Bench, internal playbooks, employee directory, and a data lake; includes stated productivity impact.

use_cases.title: AI Conversational Assistant for Project Data
use_cases.summary: Procore Assist is an AI-driven assistant embedded into the Procore platform, allowing users to ask natural language questions across project documents, RFIs, submittals, drawings, and specifications to surface project information quickly.

outcomes.note: Procore states Assist reduces time spent searching for buried project information (user quote).

media.alt: Procore Assist conversational UI

use_cases.notes: According to Procore support, Assist can answer questions about RFIs, submittals, drawings, specifications, and documents. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0} Also, Procore’s press release describes new AI Agents, Insights, and Assist platform capabilities. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

use_cases.title: Togal.AI vs. On-Screen Takeoff (OST) for Digital Quantity Takeoff
use_cases.summary: A research team from the University of Kansas evaluated Togal.AI’s automated takeoff accuracy and efficiency compared with the industry-standard On-Screen Takeoff (OST). The study found Togal.AI produced highly comparable results to OST with substantial time savings.

outcomes.note: Measured in controlled experiments comparing Togal.AI to OST by University of Kansas researchers.
Reported mean difference in total area/quantity between Togal.AI and OST results.

media.alt: Comparison of Togal.AI and On-Screen Takeoff outputs in KU study

use_cases.notes: Independent academic evaluation by the University of Kansas validates automated takeoff accuracy and speed. Provides one of the first empirical benchmarks comparing AI-assisted and traditional quantity takeoff workflows.

use_cases.title: AI-Based Progress Tracking for Concrete and Finishing Works
use_cases.summary: NCC implemented Buildots’ computer-vision platform on a large residential project to automatically compare 360° site imagery with the BIM model. The AI system generated progress dashboards and deviation reports, significantly reducing manual progress inspections and improving schedule adherence.

outcomes.note: Reported reduction in time spent on manual progress verification.

outcomes.value: Within 1 day per task on average
outcomes.note: Measured against the official NCC construction schedule in Buildots reports.

media.alt: Buildots progress tracking dashboard used by NCC project teams

use_cases.notes: Official NCC case study released via Buildots; validated owner deployment showing measurable process improvements in progress verification and schedule control.

use_cases.title: AI-Driven Site Safety Monitoring and Compliance
use_cases.summary: OpenSpace applies computer vision to automatically analyze 360° site images for safety compliance issues such as missing PPE, fall hazards, and blocked access routes. The AI engine flags unsafe conditions in near real time and provides visual records for auditing and worker training.

outcomes.note: Reported reduction in manual walk-through time when using AI-generated safety insights.
Automated visual scans analyze the entire 360° imagery dataset.

media.alt: OpenSpace AI safety dashboard detecting PPE compliance and hazards

use_cases.notes: Official OpenSpace use case highlighting AI safety analytics; includes examples of automated detection for PPE and fall hazards from 360° imagery captured during daily site documentation.

use_cases.title: Maximizing Construction IQ and Machine Learning for Predictive Analytics
use_cases.summary: Autodesk Construction IQ leverages machine learning models trained on millions of project data points from Autodesk Build and BIM 360 to predict quality, safety, and schedule risks. The system highlights high-risk issues and subcontractors, enabling proactive project management and improved decision-making across large construction portfolios.

outcomes.note: Reported by Autodesk internal benchmarking across pilot projects.
AI model accuracy cited in Autodesk case communications and user feedback.

media.alt: Autodesk Construction IQ dashboard showing predictive risk scores for safety and quality issues

use_cases.notes: Autodesk Construction IQ is a mature production AI platform integrated into Autodesk Build and BIM 360. The referenced article summarizes lessons from real project deployments and describes how predictive analytics improves quality and safety management.

use_cases.title: Immersive Workforce Training for Construction Safety
use_cases.summary: Skanska and creative technology studio OutHere used Unity’s real-time 3D platform to create interactive virtual training experiences for construction workers. The VR simulations replicate complex site conditions and safety scenarios, helping teams recognize hazards, improve procedural knowledge, and train remotely across global sites.

outcomes.note: Estimated reduction reported in Unity case summary based on Skanska internal metrics.
Users demonstrated increased hazard awareness compared to traditional training modules.

media.alt: Virtual reality safety training developed by Skanska and OutHere using Unity 3D

use_cases.notes: Unity case study documents collaboration between Skanska and OutHere for immersive VR-based safety and onboarding training. Demonstrates integration of synthetic environments and generative 3D modeling for workforce education in construction contexts.

use_cases.title: AI-Assisted Virtual Welding Trainers for Workforce Development
use_cases.summary: Lincoln Electric developed virtual welding training systems that use real-time sensors, computer vision, and AI analytics to evaluate torch angle, travel speed, arc distance, and bead quality. The system provides instant feedback to trainees, improving skill acquisition and reducing material waste in welding education programs.

outcomes.note: Reported by Lincoln Electric training evaluations when substituting early practice with virtual sessions.
Measured improvement in student progression across welding fundamentals.

media.alt: Lincoln Electric VRTEX virtual welding trainer with AI feedback interface

use_cases.notes: Lincoln Electric’s VRTEX and REALWELD systems integrate AI-based motion tracking and feedback scoring for welding education. Deployed in trade schools and contractor apprenticeship programs worldwide.

use_cases.title: Automated Takeoff to Expand Bid Capacity
use_cases.summary: Petticoat-Schmitt Civil Contractors implemented BEAM AI’s automated takeoff software to replace manual plan takeoffs. The AI workflow shortened takeoff cycles from multiple days to significantly faster turnarounds and enabled the team to bid more projects without adding headcount.

outcomes.note: Case study headline: 'Doubles Bid Capacity'.
Narrative states takeoff cycles were reduced from 2–3 days using automated takeoffs.

media.alt: BEAM AI automated takeoff interface for Petticoat-Schmitt case study

use_cases.notes: Corrected to reflect estimating/takeoff automation (not equipment productivity). Based strictly on the BEAM AI case page.

use_cases.title: AI-Driven Construction Optioneering on HS2 Project
use_cases.summary: ALIGN JV, the main civil works contractor for the UK’s High Speed 2 (HS2) railway, collaborated with ALICE Technologies to use AI-driven construction optioneering. The platform simulated thousands of construction scenarios for tunnel and viaduct packages, helping planners optimize resource sequencing, duration, and cost outcomes.

outcomes.note: AI-generated alternative schedules for tunnel and viaduct works.
Enabled the JV team to test constraints and evaluate mitigation strategies early in planning.

companies.name: ALIGN JV (Bouygues Travaux Publics, Sir Robert McAlpine, VolkerFitzpatrick)

media.alt: AI-driven construction optioneering model for HS2 by ALICE Technologies and ALIGN JV

use_cases.notes: Official ALICE Technologies case study describing HS2 collaboration with ALIGN JV. Demonstrates production-level use of AI for optioneering and scenario optimization in large-scale civil infrastructure projects.

use_cases.title: Virtual Reality Construction Hazard Identification and Crane Safety Training
use_cases.summary: Bechtel partnered with Industrial Training International (ITI) to use VR-based hazard identification and crane operation training systems. The immersive simulation enables workers to identify jobsite hazards, assess crane lift planning scenarios, and practice safety procedures in a virtual environment before entering live sites.

outcomes.note: Bechtel internal pilot showed improved identification rates after VR training.
VR-based sessions reduced logistics and material costs associated with traditional training setups.

media.alt: Bechtel workforce using ITI VR hazard identification and crane safety simulator

use_cases.notes: Official Bechtel–ITI collaboration combining VR simulation and AI-based assessment analytics for construction hazard identification and crane safety training. Validated through pilot results and press release announcing expansion of workforce development opportunities. (See also: https://www.bechtel.com/press-releases/bechtel-collaborates-with-iti-to-broaden-workforce-development-opportunities/)

use_cases.title: AI Contract Automation and Compliance Review for Construction Projects
use_cases.summary: Civils.ai developed an AI platform to automate the review of complex construction contracts, extracting clauses, identifying compliance gaps, and linking obligations to project records. The system enables engineers and contract administrators to find relevant terms instantly and reduce manual review effort in large infrastructure projects.

outcomes.note: Reported by Civils.ai based on user benchmarks in infrastructure project pilots.
Automated extraction reduced missed compliance terms during manual reviews.

media.alt: Civils.ai contract automation interface highlighting AI clause extraction and compliance tagging

use_cases.notes: Official Civils.ai case study describing AI-driven automation of construction contract analysis and compliance checking. Demonstrates measurable reductions in document review time and improved risk visibility across project portfolios.

use_cases.title: LiDAR-Equipped Robots for Automated Construction Progress Tracking
use_cases.summary: Doxel deployed autonomous robots equipped with LiDAR and RGB cameras to capture 3D data from active construction sites. The AI system compares scans with BIM models to measure installed work, detect deviations, and forecast schedule and cost impacts, enabling project teams to manage progress with data-driven insights.

outcomes.note: Enabled continuous comparison between as-built and BIM model conditions.
Reported in field tests covered by IEEE Spectrum and Doxel engineering documentation.

media.alt: Doxel autonomous LiDAR-equipped robot scanning a construction site for progress tracking

use_cases.notes: Independent IEEE Spectrum feature documenting Doxel’s real-world deployment of LiDAR-equipped robots for automated site progress monitoring and BIM deviation analysis.

use_cases.title: AI Assist for Estimating and Takeoff Workflows
use_cases.summary: STACK Construction Technologies introduced AI Assist to streamline quantity takeoffs and cost estimating. The generative-AI tool analyzes project drawings and documents, identifies relevant scopes, and recommends line items or assemblies from estimating databases—reducing manual input and improving bid accuracy.

outcomes.note: STACK reports significant time savings in early pilot feedback after integrating AI Assist.
AI Assist enables estimators to complete more bids within the same time window.

media.alt: STACK AI Assist interface suggesting cost items during digital takeoff

use_cases.notes: Official STACK Construction Technologies announcement introducing AI Assist for digital takeoff and estimating workflows. Demonstrates generative AI use in real preconstruction environments for faster, more accurate quantity estimation.

use_cases.title: AI-Assisted Contract and Risk Review
use_cases.summary: Blois Construction adopted Document Crunch’s AI platform to streamline contract review and risk identification. The system automatically highlights key clauses, inconsistent terms, and compliance risks in project documents, enabling faster reviews and more consistent risk management across bids and projects.

outcomes.note: Blois Construction reported halving the time required for initial contract analysis.
AI-assisted review identified recurring risk language and improved compliance alignment.

media.alt: Document Crunch AI interface showing contract clause analysis for Blois Construction

use_cases.notes: Official Document Crunch case study describing Blois Construction’s deployment of AI for contract and risk review. Demonstrates measurable efficiency gains and improved standardization in preconstruction risk assessment workflows.

use_cases.title: Design Risk Detection in Preconstruction Review
use_cases.summary: RO (Rogers-O’Brien) Construction uses Firmus AI’s machine learning platform to analyze design documents and flag constructability, coordination, and specification risks early in preconstruction. The system scans BIM drawings and specifications to detect missing information and potential scope gaps before bidding or field mobilization.

outcomes.value: Hundreds of constructability and coordination risks identified per project
outcomes.note: Reported by RO Construction in Firmus AI case summary.
AI analysis reduces manual document and spec review effort in early preconstruction.

media.alt: Firmus AI interface showing automated design risk detection for RO Construction

use_cases.notes: Official Firmus AI case study detailing Rogers-O’Brien Construction’s use of AI for early design and specification risk analysis. Demonstrates measurable time savings and improved coordination visibility during preconstruction document reviews.

use_cases.title: Hensel Phelps + HoloBuilder: AI-Enhanced 360° Site Documentation for Collaboration and Progress Tracking
use_cases.summary: Hensel Phelps adopted HoloBuilder’s AI-enabled 360° photo documentation platform to automate progress tracking and enhance communication among project stakeholders. The system captures time-linked 360° imagery, aligns it with BIM and floor plans, and uses AI to organize site data for efficient issue resolution and stakeholder coordination.

outcomes.note: Hensel Phelps reported halving the time spent on manual photo documentation using HoloBuilder’s automated system.
AI-organized 360° photos accelerated review cycles among owners, engineers, and subcontractors.

media.alt: HoloBuilder 360° site capture interface used by Hensel Phelps for progress tracking

use_cases.notes: Official HoloBuilder case study detailing Hensel Phelps’ deployment of AI-enhanced 360° progress tracking for construction collaboration and documentation efficiency. Verified production use with measurable time savings and communication improvements.

use_cases.title: AI Workforce Assistant for Jobsite Productivity and Safety
use_cases.summary: Gilbane Building Company deployed Trunk Tools’ AI assistant across multiple jobsites to streamline workforce communication, safety checks, and productivity reporting. The AI analyzes daily logs, schedules, and field notes to automate updates, flag issues, and provide personalized task summaries for site teams.

outcomes.note: Reported efficiency improvement during Gilbane’s early rollout as covered by ENR.
Trunk Tools and Gilbane confirmed enterprise-wide rollout in 2024 press and ENR coverage.

media.alt: Trunk Tools AI assistant interface used by Gilbane jobsite teams for safety and reporting

use_cases.notes: ENR-highlighted rollout of Trunk Tools’ AI workforce assistant across Gilbane Building Company projects. Demonstrates field-verified productivity and safety monitoring improvements through conversational AI and automated reporting workflows.
